title: Pull request merge from banilo/nilearn:connectome_bug to nilearn/nilearn:master

text: Also can you rebase on master so we get the coverage and the python 3 support?

Could you add a smoke test too, an adjacency_matrix like:

```
np.array([
    [1., np.nan, 0.],
    [np.nan, 1., 0.],
    [np.nan, 0., 1.]])
```

should be fine.
I added the nan-test. Your suggestion however would be a test for lacking symmetry :-P

> Your suggestion however would be a test for lacking symmetry :-P

That was on purpose, since this is a edge case we happen to be supporting...

It does give a not-symmetric error. Is that intended?

2015-03-11 16:38 GMT+01:00 Loïc Estève notifications@github.com:

> Your suggestion however would be a test for lacking symmetry :-P
> 
> That was on purpose, since this is a edge case we happen to be
> supporting...
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/nilearn/nilearn/pull/491#issuecomment-78288309.

## 

Viele Grüße,
Danilo

> It does give a not-symmetric error. Is that intended? 

:confused: I was naively expecting that the nan_to_num conversion would make the adjacency matrix symmetrix.
